titleInfo.title: Letter from His Excellency Lieutenant-Colonel Justin Sheil CB, Her Majesty's Minister Plenipotentiary and Envoy Extraordinary at the Court of Persia, Tehran, to Lieutenant-Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire

mods.abstract: Justin Sheil refers to Samuel Hennell's despatch (no. 169) of 26 April 1850, which concerned a recent act of piracy, committed by the Chief of Nabend. Sheil opines that it would not be at all advisable to allow the maratime [maritime] chiefs to suppose that they could redress their grievances by their own means. Instead, Sheil argues that the best course of action would be for Hennell to act on the permission formerly given by the Govenor of Fars to repress and punish acts of piracy. Sheil instructs Hennell to capture at sea one of the boats of the Sheikh of Nabend, but to do so with a large enough force to preclude any resistance from the pirates.
